question.content:
**Which of the following shapes show a line of symmetry?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A line passes through the left and right points of a rhombus.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d823701f9f7a9f2abefcbf946330207b98acb8a4)
![A line passes through the base and top point of a triangle.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/1bdba2584978feaa54ff3e623af0e034e333caca)
![A line passes through the top left corner and bottom right corner of a rectangle.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/06b0bc5ab2317134a7211de48655c0a8774a2ae8)

hints.content:
###What is a line of symmetry? 

A line of symmetry is a line where we can fold the image and have both halves match exactly.

When we divide the following figure with the line, the resulting two parts are  **not** mirror images of each other:



[[☃ image 1]]

This figure does **not** show a line of symmetry.

options.alt: A line passes through the top left corner and bottom right corner of a rectangle.

hints.content:
When we divide these figures with the line, the resulting two parts are mirror images of each other:


[[☃ image 1]]


[[☃ image 2]]

These figures show lines of symmetry.

options.alt: A line passes through the left and right points of a rhombus.
A line passes through the base and top point of a triangle.

hints.content:
The following figures show lines of symmetry:

 | |
- | - | -

[[☃ image 1]]



[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A line passes through the left and right points of a rhombus.
A line passes through the base and top point of a triangle.

question.content:
**Which of the following shapes show a line of symmetry?**


[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
###What is a line of symmetry? 

A line of symmetry is a line where we can fold the image and have both halves match exactly.

When we divide the following figure with the line, the resulting two parts are  **not** mirror images of each other:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/9e3eb7cd1ad922f70215118bfba37ffb96816c70)

This figure does **not** show a line of symmetry.

When we divide these figures with the line, the resulting two parts are mirror images of each other:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ea546a85177caf3f636277bb81a7b1f5061160e4)

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0f3ba9c487452b3a55454c327bbfebb54d4076b6)

These figures show lines of symmetry.

The following figures show lines of symmetry:

 | |
- | - | -
![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ea546a85177caf3f636277bb81a7b1f5061160e4) | ![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0f3ba9c487452b3a55454c327bbfebb54d4076b6)

question.content:
**Which shapes have line symmetry?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
A $\greenD{\text{line of symmetry}}$ is an imaginary line where the image can be folded to make two halves that match exactly, like mirror images. 

A shape has $\purpleD{\text{line symmetry}}$ if it has at least one line of symmetry.

We can draw at least one $\greenD{\text{line of symmetry}}$ on the following shape:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4fdd9d009d8b8414bfe535865d0cb3360343dc5c)

So, this shape has $\purpleD{\text{line symmetry}}$.  

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4547a59bc0a312e70f0e189a95e233c464a656d1)

choices.content: ![A triangular-like shape that has a line that starts at the top and moves down and right, then at the end moves down and to the left, then up and slightly to the right. The line then continues down and left, then continues up and slightly right to the beginning of the first line.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/46447240bec90186d45f819aae135b6342df86d6)
![A triangle with three sides of equal length.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5eab0a1248a79745d3c851d75ea9abc189d74278)

hints.content:
A $\greenD{\text{line of symmetry}}$ is an imaginary line where the image can be folded to make two halves that match exactly, like mirror images. 

A shape has $\purpleD{\text{line symmetry}}$ if it has at least one line of symmetry.

We can draw at least one $\greenD{\text{line of symmetry}}$ on the following shapes:


[[☃ image 1]]



[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A triangle with three sides of equal length. The triangle has three lines of symmetry, each cutting it in half through the center.
A square with two lines of symmetry, each cutting it in half through the center.

hints.content:
So, these shapes have $\purpleD{\text{line symmetry}}$.  



[[☃ image 1]]



[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A triangle with three sides of equal length.

question.content:
**Which shapes are symmetrical?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

hints.content:
A $\greenD{\text{line of symmetry}}$ is an imaginary line where the image can be folded to make two halves that match exactly, like mirror images. 

A shape has $\purpleD{\text{line symmetry}}$ if it has at least one line of symmetry.

We can draw at least one $\greenD{\text{line of symmetry}}$ on the following shapes:

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/18f700ae6fb9e8abcbbae4c21b6cdbca4680b18e)

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ec012e56b25c87741e29d010df13a12e72cf8ceb)

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/64a1c4216d88f3e0f70686cf2154eee2a2e253d4)

So, these shapes have $\purpleD{\text{line symmetry}}$.  

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4547a59bc0a312e70f0e189a95e233c464a656d1)

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/1077a6dbb74ad271736c6e5e4638ac441d4a45b8)

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0280dc568b325137cf0d2833da52f82508e100db)

question.content:
**Draw a line of symmetry through the triangle by connecting two black points.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

hints.content:
A line of symmetry is a line where we can fold the image and have both halves match exactly.


How can we position the line so each half is a mirror image of the other?

The line of symmetry should look like this: 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a07b50f3bf22a004f9e65334e89f4e6781a6d48f)
